TMDA Press Coverage

April 2003

  • Sounding off: And none shall pass
    The Sunday Times, David Hewson
    ``What we need is some kind of halfway house: a whitelist with intelligence. And if you head off over to the home of the Tagged Message Delivery Agent, that is exactly what you will find.''
    The readers of Britain's top-selling Sunday broadsheet are introduced to TMDA and the idea of whitelisting with challenges as an effective alternative to traditional filters.

November 2002

  • Death by Spam
    Slate Magazine, Kevin Werbach
    Also available on MSNBC.
    ``The e-mail you know and love is about to vanish.''
    TMDA is listed as one of the ``whitelist applications'' available today in this article about the changing tide of Internet e-mail, and the rise of whitelists as an effective countermeasure.

October 2002

  • Getting wired: Weapons for fighting spam
    Computer Weekly, Glyn Moody

    TMDA is mentioned at the end of this article as an example of using the whitelist methodology to fight spam.

September 2002

  • At Last, A Cure For Spam
    The Daily Aardvark, Bruce Simpson
    ``Believe it or not a cure for spam is readily available and 100% free -- so why isn't your ISP using it?''
    A rave review of TMDA given to the readers of the Daily Aardvark, New Zealand's leading source of Net-Industry news and commentary.

August 2002

  • Junk mail causing demand for anti-spam software
    The Associated Press, Anick Jesdanun

    TMDA is featured in this story about countermeasures, which is the last in a three-part series that examines the surge in spam, the people behind it, and the struggle to thwart them.
